unnormalised: RBI’s recent repo rate hike is gonna make your EMIs pricier, guys! Several banks, including SBI and HDFC, are expected to increase their lending rates by at least 25 bps. This will directly impact folks with existing home loans, personal loans, and even car loans.
normalised: R-B-I's recent repo rate hike is gonna make your E-M-Is pricier, guys! Several banks, including S-B-I and H-D-F-C, are expected to increase their lending rates by at least twenty five basis points. This will directly impact folks with existing home loans, personal loans, and even car loans.

unnormalised: Sources say that the average home loan interest rate is now hovering around 8.5% p.a., but could easily cross 9% in the next few months. So, if you're planning to take a loan, maybe prepone your plans or brace yourselves for higher monthly outgo.
normalised: Sources say that the average home loan interest rate is now hovering around eight point five percent per annum, but could easily cross nine percent in the next few months. So, if you're planning to take a loan, maybe prepone your plans or brace yourselves for higher monthly outgo.

unnormalised: For example, a ₹50 lakh home loan with a 20-year tenure could see your EMI increase by roughly ₹800-₹1000 per month. That's a significant amount for many middle-class families. Experts suggest exploring options like balance transfers to banks offering lower interest rates, if possible.
normalised: For example, a rupee fifty lakh home loan with a twenty year tenure could see your E-M-I increase by roughly eight hundred to one thousand rupees per month. That's a significant amount for many middle-class families. Experts suggest exploring options like balance transfers to banks offering lower interest rates, if possible.

unnormalised: Credit card users, take note! Interest rates on outstanding balances are already sky-high (think 36%-40% p.a.). Missing payments will only make things worse, so make sure you're paying your dues on time. And try to avoid using your credit card for big purchases unless absolutely necessary.

Missing payments will only make things worse, so make sure you're paying your dues on time. And try to avoid using your credit card for big purchases unless absolutely necessary.

unnormalised: Fintech companies like Paytm and PhonePe, which offer instant personal loans, might also revise their interest rates. These loans, often ranging from ₹5,000 to ₹2 lakh, usually come with higher interest rates compared to traditional bank loans.
normalised: Fintech companies like Paytm and PhonePe, which offer instant personal loans, might also revise their interest rates. These loans, often ranging from five thousand rupees to two lakh rupees, usually come with higher interest rates compared to traditional bank loans.

unnormalised: Financial advisors are recommending that people re-evaluate their budgets and prioritize debt repayment to minimize the impact of rising interest rates. Consider consolidating your debts or opting for a debt management plan.
normalised: Financial advisors are recommending that people re-evaluate their budgets and prioritize debt repayment to minimize the impact of rising interest rates. Consider consolidating your debts or opting for a debt management plan.

unnormalised: Bottom line: The era of cheap loans is over, at least for now. Be smart about your borrowing, shop around for the best rates, and make sure you can comfortably afford your EMIs before taking on any new debt. Stay safe and invest wisely.
